headline: BESS wins in Poland capacity market falls for the first time, de-rating cut to blame
summary_80w: The results of Poland's capacity market (CM) were announced this week, with fewer awards to BESS than last year because of a reduction in the technology's de-rating factor.

headline: BayWa r.e. sells 46MW floating solar PV plant in the Netherlands
summary_80w: German renewable energy developer BayWa r.e., along with its Dutch subsidiary GroenLeven, has sold a 46MW floating solar PV (FPV) project in the northern province of Friesland, the Netherlands.

headline: SEIA says SPEED Act is ‘unequal’ in treatment of solar PV
summary_80w: The US House of Representatives has passed a permitting reform bill reducing the environmental scrutiny on large energy projects.

headline: Chinese polysilicon production has recorded its first decline in 12 years – CPIA
summary_80w: Wang Bohua, honorary chairman of the China PV Industry Association (CPIA), said that the polysilicon production in China experienced its first year-on-year decline since 2013, while wafer production registered its first year-on-year decline since 2009.

headline: Maturation of UK solar and storage has contributed to ‘execution’ risk
summary_80w: 'The UK market has matured,' Guy Lavarack, chief investment officer at the Luminous Energy Group, tells PV Tech Premium this week.

headline: How storage and sophistication can limit financial risk in European solar PV
summary_80w: PV Talk: Luminous Energy's Guy Lavarack says that interface risk, grid risk and talent risk are all key risk factors in Europe.

headline: NYPA to develop 1.2GW of additional storage as part of renewed energy plan, in face of ‘strong federal headwinds’
summary_80w: The board of trustees for New York Power Authority (NYPA) last week gave the greenlight for the public power organisation to develop an additional 1.2GW of storage as part of its renewed Strategic Plan for New Renewable Energy Generation.

headline: Egypt: AMEA Power secures IFC funds for ‘Africa’s largest single-site renewables and battery project’
summary_80w: The World Bank’s International Finance Corporation has agreed a financing package for a 1GW solar PV power plant paired with 600MWh of energy storage in Egypt.

headline: Australian government supports additional 40GWh of Cheaper Home Batteries by 2030
summary_80w: The Australian government has expanded the nationwide Cheaper Home Batteries Program, which has seen rapid uptake from homeowners.

headline: GridStor executes tolling agreement for Texas BESS, CPS Energy launches 500MW BESS RFP
summary_80w: Two US companies, GridStor, and CPS Energy are making advancements on Texas energy storage deployments, with GridStor executing a tolling agreement and CPS Energy issuing a new request for proposals.

headline: PV Tech Power 44 out now: The evolution of PV quality assurance
summary_80w: The latest edition of our print journal, PV Tech Power, is out today and available to download, where we deep dive into PV quality assurance.

headline: The solar industry is playing perpetual catch-up on module reliability
summary_80w: PV Talk: Paul Gebhardt of Fraunhofer ISE discusses reliability issues facing advanced PV modules, an issue which isn't going anywhere.

headline: Voltalia begins construction works at 43MW/135MWh solar-plus-storage in French Guiana
summary_80w: French renewables company Voltalia has started site preparation works on a 43MW/135MWh solar-plus-storage project in French Guiana, a French overseas territory in South America.

headline: Pivot Energy raises US$225 million for community solar, CleanCapital secures US$185 million
summary_80w: Pivot Energy has completed three financing agreements, totalling US$225 million, while CleanCapital has raised US$185 million.

headline: AMEA Power commissions 120MW solar PV plant in Tunisia, country’s largest
summary_80w: UAE-based renewables developer AMEA Power has commissioned a 120MW solar PV plant in the central Tunisian governorate of Kairouan, the country’s largest operational PV project.

headline: Unlocking maximum value from G12 modules on tracker systems
summary_80w: If we imagine the development of PV industry in terms of scale and quality on a single curve, its trajectory has clearly been moving upward.

headline: Grenergy secures funding for 172MW Ayora solar PV plant in Spain
summary_80w: Spanish IPP Grenergy has secured a senior non-recourse financing agreement worth €98.8 million for the172MW Ayora solar PV project in Spain.

headline: Petrobras acquires 49.9% stake in Lightsource bp’s Brazilian subsidiaries
summary_80w: Petrobras has acquired 49.9% of solar developer Lightsource bp’s subsidiaries in Brazil, for a 'not materially significant' amount of money.

headline: California CCA throws support behind two thermal battery storage startup developers
summary_80w: California Community Choice Aggregator (CCA) Clean Power Alliance (CPA) last week (8 December 2025) moved one step closer to executing agreements for offtake with two companies developing innovative thermal battery storage projects.

headline: US virtual power plant programmes advance with new partnerships and investment
summary_80w: Distributed energy resources (DERs) are emerging as potential solutions for consumers seeking independence and relief from rising energy costs.

headline: ‘Evolving revenue mix, harsh Nordic operating conditions’: Hitachi Energy supplies PCS to Finland’s largest BESS
summary_80w: Finland’s largest BESS to date will need to cope with “especially challenging” operating conditions and stringent and evolving grid code requirements.

headline: Sungrow and Algihaz’ 7.8GWh Saudi Arabia BESS connected to grid
summary_80w: Three BESS projects totalling 7.8GWh in Saudi Arabia have been connected to the electricity grid, technology provider Sungrow said.

headline: Queensland government says it, not councils, will decide on battery storage projects in Australian state
summary_80w: New laws went into effect last week in Queensland, Australia, that mean large-scale battery storage project applications must be dealt with at the state level.

headline: European BESS: 800MW of project awards, M&A and financing announced across continent
summary_80w: It's been a busy few weeks in the run-up to Christmas in Europe's BESS project space, with M&A, final investment decisions (FID) and supplier deals in Germany, Belgium, Portugal, Italy, Finland, Romania and the UK totally around 800MW of capacity.

headline: T1 Energy begins construction at 2.1GW TOPCon cell manufacturing facility in Texas
summary_80w: T1 Energy has started construction on the 2.1GW first phase of its TOPCon cell manufacturing facility in Texas.

headline: Ib vogt sells 95.18MW Baobab solar PV plant in Spain
summary_80w: Renewables developer ib vogt has sold the 95.18MW Baobab solar PV project in Segovia, central Spain, to a subsidiary of Swiss independent power producer (IPP) EOS NER.

headline: JA Solar JV starts work on Egypt PV and storage manufacturing plant
summary_80w: JA Solar is a lead partner in a joint venture that broke ground this week on a new 2GW solar PV cell, 2GW module and 1GWh energy storage manufacturing facility in Egypt.

headline: Doral Renewables signs PPA for 270MW Kansas solar project
summary_80w: Doral Renewables has signed a PPA to sell power generated at its 270MW Lambs Draw solar PV project, which will be built in Kansas.

headline: Germany lowers tender price cap for rooftop solar PV in 2026 to €0.1/kWh
summary_80w: Germany has revised down the price ceiling for roof-mounted solar PV systems to €0.1/kWh (US$0.117/kWh) for tenders to be held in 2026.

headline: ERCOT BESS revenue ‘roller coaster’ is a feature, not a bug
summary_80w: In an upcoming conversation with Energy-Storage.news Premium and Optimisation platform provider Ascend Analytics, CEO Dr. Gary Dorris PhD, discusses the ‘roller coaster’ revenues of the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) market.

headline: US energy storage installations in 2025 have already surpassed last year’s total: Wood Mac
summary_80w: According to the Q4 2025 US Energy Storage Monitor from Wood Mackenzie Power & Renewables and the American Clean Power Association (ACP), 2025 energy storage installations surpassed 2024 capacity.

headline: How thermal energy storage (TES) makes steam from renewables economically viable
summary_80w: Thermal energy storage can make steam for chemical industries and manufacturing economically viable, writes Martin Schichtel, CEO and Founder of Kraftblock.

headline: Akuo Energy, Voltalia kick off projects in French overseas territories New Caledonia, French Guiana
summary_80w: Renewable energy companies Akuo Energy and Voltalia have begun constructing projects in French overseas territories.

headline: Ford’s ‘big strategic pivot’ into the ‘fiercely competitive’ battery storage market
summary_80w: Ford Motor Company’s entry into the “fiercely competitive” energy storage market is a “big strategic pivot,” but one that makes sense, ESN Premium has heard.

headline: Ecoprogetti installs 400MW TOPCon, HJT manufacturing plant in Oman for AACE
summary_80w: Ecoprogetti has installed a new 400MW module production facility in Oman, to be operated by American Advanced Clean Energy (AACE).

headline: Solar inverter market to shrink in 2025-26 amid uncertainty in China, US, EU
summary_80w: The global solar inverter industry will contract over the next two years as major markets in China, Europe and the US confront new volatility, according to energy market analyst Wood Mackenzie.

headline: GameChange Solar to supply 1.2GW trackers to Khulis solar PV project in Saudi Arabia
summary_80w: GameChange Solar will supply 1.2GW of trackers for ACWA Power’s 2GW Khulis solar PV project, currently under construction in Saudi Arabia.

headline: EU identifies solar inverters as ‘high-risk’ in new Security Doctrine
summary_80w: The EU’s Economic Security Doctrine has identified solar inverters as a high-risk dependency, a move which the European Solar Manufacturing Council (ESMC) has lauded.

headline: UL Solutions grants 9703 certification to Voltage Energy 2kV EBOS products
summary_80w: Voltage Energy has received what it calls the solar industry’s first full-system 2kV EBOS certification from UL Solutions.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Shell immersion cooling partnership, PNNL begins utility-scale battery tests, ON.Energy in 5GW transformer deal
summary_80w: In this edition of the Energy-Storage.news US news roundup, EticaAG partners with Shell on battery immersion tech, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory begins utility-scale battery testing, and ON.Energy announces a transformer supply agreement.

headline: Georgia Power agrees electric bill deal with regulators to enable 9.9GW resource addition
summary_80w: Utility Georgia Power has reached an agreement with the Public Interest Advocacy (PIA) staff of the Georgia Public Service Commission (PSC), that, if approved, will help lower energy costs and meet electricity demand in the state.

headline: Turning data centres from a ‘potential liability to a grid asset’: Calibrant on its first-of-a-kind BESS with Aligned
summary_80w: Calibrant's BESS for a new data centre in Oregon, US, was hailed as the first of its kind, but what are the details beyond the headline? We caught up with Calibrant's CCO to discuss the practical, commercial and technical specifics of the project.

headline: Hithium launches 8-hour dedicated battery cell and BESS, sodium-lithium hybrid data centre solution
summary_80w: Lithium-ion OEM Hithium has unveiled a new, even larger format 1,300Ah battery cell for 8-hour BESS applications, alongside new related BESS products.

headline: Battery storage system prices continue to fall sharply, BNEF and Ember reports find
summary_80w: Global average prices for turnkey battery storage systems fell by almost a third year-over-year, with sharp cost declines expected to continue.

headline: Global BESS installs hit 14GWh in November, including 1GWh sodium-ion project; China slows
summary_80w: A total of around 4.9GW/14GWh of grid-scale BESS entered commercial operations around the world last month, a 29% fall year-on-year owing to an unusually slow month in China.

headline: Akaysha Energy enters 300MWh BESS into NEM trading in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Waratah Super Battery developer Akaysha Energy has put the first phase of its Ulinda Park BESS project into operation in Queensland, Australia.

headline: France awards 507MW solar PV in latest tender, average price decreases to €74.13/MWh
summary_80w: France has awarded 507.7MW of solar PV capacity in its latest technology neutral auction, with only solar projects selected.

headline: Korea Power Exchange to announce winners of 540MW/3,240MWh energy storage auction in February
summary_80w: Results of an auction to procure large-scale energy storage to support the electric grid in South Korea will be announced in February.

headline: How Imperial Star came up with its US solar domestic content calculator
summary_80w: Imperial Star's DomesticIQ calculator aims to bring some clarity to the complexities of navigating US solar domestic content requirements.

headline: SEG Solar breaks ground on 3GW ingot/wafer PV manufacturing plant in Indonesia
summary_80w: Solar manufacturer SEG Solar has started construction on a 3GW ingot and wafer manufacturing plant in Indonesia.

headline: Acciona Energia sells stake in 1.3GW US solar PV portfolio
summary_80w: Spanish renewables developer Acciona Energia has sold a 49% minority stake in a 1.3GW US solar PV project portfolio.

headline: Soltec confirms 80% share buyout, continues focus on solar trackers
summary_80w: Soltec has begun the process of transferring 80% of its share ownership to European investment firm DVC Solutions.

headline: Maxeon files new BC patent infringement lawsuit against Aiko in Germany
summary_80w: Solar manufacturer Maxeon has filed a new patent infringement lawsuit against fellow PV manufacturer Aiko before the Munich Regional Court I in Germany.

headline: Energy Storage Europe welcomes EU proposal to end ‘first-come-first-served’ grid connections
summary_80w: Trade association Energy Storage Europe (ESE) has welcomed proposed reforms to European Union (EU) grid connection and permitting processes.

headline: Single 100MW BESS outage could cause a US$1.2 million monthly loss, cybersecurity report finds
summary_80w: A new battery energy storage system (BESS) cybersecurity whitepaper from consultancy firm The Brattle Group and cybersecurity solutions provider Dragos claims that a single 100MW/400MWh BESS outage could result in US$1.2 million in monthly losses.

headline: EUROPE ROUND-UP: Encavis acquires solar PV portfolio in Italy, Iberdrola and Sonnedix advance Spanish projects
summary_80w: A round-up of news coming from Europe, with IPP Encavis acquiring a 265MW solar PV portfolio in Italy, Iberdrola starting construction on 366MW of solar PV in its home country and IPP Sonnedix signing a renewables supply agreement with a subsidiary of Volkswagen in Spain.

headline: FINANCE ROUND-UP: Potentia, Origis and Baywa r.e. close PV financing deals
summary_80w: A roundup of three solar PV project financing stories from Australia, Texas and California, with updates from Potentia Energy, Origis Energy and Baywa r.e.

headline: India’s PLI drives ‘robust’ solar manufacturing, but upstream lacking muscle
summary_80w: India’s flagship solar PV manufacturing incentive has driven “robust growth” in the sector since its launch, but hurdles remain to building a complete domestic supply chain.

headline: US solar PV companies are not waiting for FEOC guidance – Crux survey
summary_80w: Solar PV companies in the US are not waiting for guidance from the US Departments of the Treasury or Energy to act regarding Foreign Entity of Concern (FEOC), according to a survey conducted by Crux.

headline: US solar module prices stabilise at US$0.28/W in November
summary_80w: US solar PV module prices have stabilised at just over US$0.28/W in the three months to November 2025, according to Anza.

headline: Poland shortlists energy storage projects for €1 billion in grants
summary_80w: The Ministry of the Environment in Poland has shortlisted projects for an energy storage capex support programme totalling 4.15 billion PLN (c.€1 billion), with 183 eligible to progress to the next round.

headline: System integrator Guoxia Technology to go Public in Hong Kong on 16 December
summary_80w: System integrator Guoxia Technology has obtained approval for its main board listing on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.

headline: Malaysia’s first large-scale battery storage system inaugurated in Sabah, Borneo
summary_80w: A 100MW/400MWh BESS, the biggest project of its kind by output in Southeast Asia, has been welcomed into operation in Sabah, Malaysia.

headline: Origin selects Wärtsilä for expansion of Australia’s largest approved BESS by capacity at Eraring
summary_80w: Utility Origin Energy has hired Wärtsilä to expand its battery storage installation at the Eraring coal power plant site in New South Wales, Australia.

headline: ACWA Power, Scatec sign gigawatt-scale MENA solar-plus-storage project deals
summary_80w: Two major Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region projects combining solar PV and battery storage have progressed in Saudi Arabia and Egypt through ACWA Power and Scatec, respectively.

headline: Chinese polysilicon industry creates new “inventory platform” with RMB3 billion capital
summary_80w: The Chinese polysilicon industry has emerged with a new "inventory platform" with a RMB30 billion capital aimed at increasing prices.

headline: Europe’s solar boom hits brakes, slowing market could be ‘self-destructive’, says SolarPower Europe
summary_80w: Slowing solar PV and energy storage installations in Europe risks “competitiveness and security at a pivotal moment”, according to the head of SolarPower Europe.

headline: European Commission proposes European Grids Package to improve connection infrastructure
summary_80w: The European Commission has proposed improvements to Europe’s energy infrastructure, aiming to accelerate the grid permitting process.

headline: Italy awards 1.1GW of solar PV in NZIA auction
summary_80w: Italy has awarded 88 projects for a combined 1.1GW of solar PV in its Net Zero Industry Act (NZIA) non-price criteria FER-X auction.

headline: Ciel & Terre releases new rail-based solar PV floating structure
summary_80w: Floating solar PV (FPV) firm Ciel & Terre has unveiled a new floating structure, dubbed WattRack, with a rail-based structure.

headline: How distributed energy resources could combat soaring electricity costs in the US
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with John Farrell, Co-Director of The Institute for Local Self-Reliance (ILSR), on rising utility costs and the role energy storage can play.

headline: US BESS deals: Samsung SDI’s first LFP contract, Trina’s 1GWh+ agreement with Lightshift
summary_80w: South Korea’s Samsung SDI has signed its first US lithium iron phosphate (LFP) cell deal, while Chinese integrator Trina Storage has expanded an existing supply partnership.

headline: Germany firmly enters large-scale BESS era with EnBW, Vattenfall and Enertrag project news
summary_80w: A trio of large-scale BESS announcements by major power firms of 700-800MWh capacity each in Germany show the country's energy storage market moving into the new era of scale.

headline: Battery storage assets in Europe could see 3% ROI uplift with 15-minute trading, Rystad says
summary_80w: The recent introduction of 15-minute settlement periods across European power markets could result in significantly higher profits for battery storage asset operators.

headline: SEIA appoints Darren Van’t Hof as interim president and CEO
summary_80w: The US SEIA has named board chair Darren Van’t Hof as interim president and CEO, to begin work 20 January 2026.

headline: Italy’s FER-X auction: a market correction or a mirage?
summary_80w: Italy's NZIA FER-X auction aims to diversify Europe's supply chain, but this brings its own challenges, writes Patrizio Donati.

headline: World hits ‘heroic achievement’ of 1TW of operating utility-scale solar capacity
summary_80w: The global utility-scale solar PV sector has exceeded the threshold of 1TW of operating capacity, according to Wiki-Solar.

headline: Plenitude begins operations at 150MW solar PV plant in Spain
summary_80w: Plentiude, the renewable energy development arm of Italian oil and gas major Eni, has started operations at a 150MW solar PV plant in Spain.

headline: US adds 11.7GW solar PV in Q3 despite permitting and political roadblocks persisting
summary_80w: The US solar industry registered its third-best quarter with 11.7GW of new capacity installed in the third quarter of 2025.

headline: European solar PV module prices stabilise in November, ahead of potential ‘oversupply situation’
summary_80w: The average price of several types of solar PV modules remained stable in Europe in November, according to sun.store.

headline: NextEra signs 2.5GW of renewable energy agreements with Meta for projects across US
summary_80w: NextEra Energy Resources and Meta have signed 11 power purchase agreements and two energy storage agreements totalling 2.5GW.

headline: Clearway negotiates 560MWh tolling agreements with California IOU SDG&E, sells BESS to yieldco
summary_80w: Clearway Energy Group has negotiated tolling agreements with SDG&E for one of its solar and storage complexes in Kern County, California.

headline: Submissions rebound in UK BESS development market in November
summary_80w: Last month was the first time since June that both pre-application submissions and full planning consent submissions for grid-scale UK BESS surpassed 1GWh - just before NESO announced the results of its grid connection queue reshuffle.

headline: Engie hires former subsidiary NHOA Energy for 320MWh Belgium battery storage project
summary_80w: NHOA Energy has secured contracts from Engie for an 80MW/320MWh BESS at Engie's Drogenbos power station, near Brussels, Belgium.

headline: Cape Verde welcomes wind and batteries that bring African island nation to nearly one-third renewable energy share
summary_80w: AFC and public-private-partnership (PPP) Cabeolica have inaugurated 13.5MW of wind power generation and 26MWh of battery storage in Cape Verde.

headline: Li-ion battery pack prices fell 8% since last year despite metals prices rising, BloombergNEF says
summary_80w: Cell manufacturing overcapacity and intense competition contributed to an 8% decline in the average cost of lithium-ion battery packs, according to BloombergNEF.

headline: 1.6GWh Melbourne Renewable Energy Hub battery storage system brought online in Australia
summary_80w: The 600MW/1.6GWh Melbourne Renewable Energy Hub has commenced commercial operations in Victoria, Australia.

headline: NEM data spotlight: Record generation meets wild price swings in Australia’s NEM in November
summary_80w: Rooftop solar PV generated nearly twice the output of utility-scale solar throughout November 2025, maintaining a 1.9:1 ratio in Australia.

headline: Waaree inks 288MW US supply deal for ‘high resilience’ bifacial modules
summary_80w: Indian solar PV manufacturer Waaree Energies has signed a 288MWp solar module supply deal with US project developer Sabanci Renewables.

headline: Equinor starts operations at its first hybrid solar-plus-wind project
summary_80w: Equinor has started commercial operations at its first hybrid solar-plus-wind project in the Brazilian state of Bahia.

headline: Tongwei Global Partner Summit 2025: Arctic protection, digital manufacturing and TNC 3.0 Modules
summary_80w: Tongwei used its Global Partner Summit to show how high-efficiency PV, digital manufacturing and biodiversity protection must advance together.

headline: ACWA Power, Bapco Energies to build 2.8GW solar-plus-storage project in Saudi Arabia
summary_80w: ACWA Power and Bapco Energies have signed an agreement to build a 2.8GW solar plant in Saudi Arabia, to be co-located with a BESS.

headline: ROUNDUP: Energy Vault enters Switzerland, ZincFive raises funds, Convergent closes on NYC financing
summary_80w: In this Energy-Storage.news roundup, Energy Vault enters the Swiss energy storage market, ZincFive raises Series F financing, and Convergent Energy and Power secures a multimillion-dollar facility provided by NY Green Bank.

headline: UK: ‘Painful but necessary’ reforms see 153GW of battery storage projects cut from grid connection queue
summary_80w: The UK’s National Energy System Operator (NESO) will offer grid connection offers up to 2035 to 283GW of projects following a reform of the process.

headline: Long-duration energy storage is non-negotiable for Europe’s energy transformation
summary_80w: European energy independence is achievable if long-duration energy storage is factored into the mix, writes Oonagh O'Grady of Hydrostor.

headline: Vena Energy signs BESS agreement with CATL for Indonesia-Singapore ‘renewable energy corridor’
summary_80w: Vena Energy has signed a battery storage supply agreement with CATL for a project which would export renewable energy from Indonesia to Singapore.

headline: Western Australia’s 500MWh vanadium flow battery initiative is a ‘pivotal moment’
summary_80w: A Western Australian government initiative to deploy the largest vanadium redox flow battery (VRFB) project outside China is a “pivotal moment,” one technology provider has said.

headline: Arizona county supervisors approve 400MWh BESS project near site of 2019 Surprise fire
summary_80w: Supervisors in Maricopa County, Arizona, have approved a 100MW/400MWh battery storage project from National Renewable Solutions (NRS).

headline: Desert Mountain Energy plans sodium nickel chloride battery factory in New Mexico
summary_80w: Vancouver-based helium and natural gas producer Desert Mountain Energy (DME) has signed a non-binding letter of intent (LOI) to form a joint venture (JV) to build and operate a sodium nickel chloride (SNC) battery manufacturing facility in Roswell, New Mexico.

headline: Angola: Energy minister inaugurates first solar-plus-storage minigrid in national rollout
summary_80w: The first of 46 solar minigrids planned in Angola has been inaugurated by João Baptista Borges, the African country’s Minister of Energy and Water.
